I have often thought that with any luck at all I could have been born a werewolf, because the two middle fingers on both my hands are the same length, but I have had to be content with what I had.
-
I was wondering about my eyes; one of my eyes–-the left–-saw everything golden and yellow and orange, and the other eye saw shades of blue and grey and green; perhaps one eye was for daylight and the other was for night. If everyone in the world saw different colors from different eyes there might be a great many new colors still to be invented.
-
All cat stories start with this statement: "My mother, who was the first cat, told me this...
-
All quotes from "We Have Always Lived in the Castle" by Shirley Jackson
-

//But I don't deserve to be heartbroken//
I dont want to write about you anymore. It hurts to look back at the memories. It hurts to write all about it all, but It just can't seems to stop. All I can think about is how much i cared, how much i loved you and how you threw it all away;not One,not twice but several times. All i ever asked for was honesty and consistency. And you failed to even do that. You failed to be the person I knew you could be. You settled for what you had and I guess that's okay. But you lost out on so much, to help you,grow and succeed. Maybe you were afraid. Maybe you didn't knew what you wanted. But you can't do rest of the life, unable to decide what you want or who you want in your life. Decisions have got to be made. Something has got to give and maybe in time, I'll forget you,if that's what's made to happen. Maybe I'll lead the life I've always wanted to, the only exception is it being without you.
I'll have the strength to carry on as I have had all along.
I'll forget the memories which have become so dear to me.
And I'll forget you,surely.
.
.
.
.
.

Life would be amazing if all of us were the 'perfect' kind of people who have nothing but love to give, nothing bad to say and overall just 'pure' human beings.
As much as we would love to believe ourselves and others to be pure, we are fools and twisted souls. We make mistakes, and due to these, harboured deep within us are feelings of guilt, helplessness and defeat.
None of us are pure. 
We love to play the innocent, but are we really?

We've all said and done things that we didn't mean, in the heat of the moment or otherwise. 
We've said things which could've been framed better. 
We've been the cause of someone's tears and sadness too. 
We have hurt people and let them down, be it family, friends or lovers.
We have done things we promised we never would, and felt the bitter feeling of regret. 
We have done things we could never tell anyone, the very thought of the words and deeds brings about a stabbing pain in us.
We have lied and been selfish, inconsiderate, insensitive and all of the things we accuse others of being.

But, what will make you different is your effort and want to be a better person. To accept your mistakes and be humble enough to apologise. To not repeat the same mistakes, and to be better than we were. 
It will take time, patience and lots of effort, but it is what will make you different. 
Your ability to accept your mistakes, however grave they are, and working on being a better person is what ultimately makes you human.🌻
.

When the girl got off the train at the college town,
she leapt up and wrapped her legs around the waist
of the boy she’d come to visit, and they spun
around, embracing and shrieking with joy.
Their love set off a piccolo’s vibration.
Those years are gone for us—I see you every day,
we eat meals together from decades-old plates.
But when we lie in bed at night, you take my hand,
and I feel the orb that’s formed around us tighten,
while you and I, like knitting needles in a ball
of yarn, lie beside each other, fingers touching.

She was not really a look back kind of girl. But every now and then, she'd catch herself reflecting on how perfectly the universe pieced together the chapters of her life. Sure, it has thrown her curveballs and obstacles. It has beaten her up and taken things from her and broken her heart. But honestly, it has also always shown her why. Always. And those are the times she loves-- when all the pieces she's been living finally fit together and form the big picture. The one that makes sense. The one that shows why each and every thing that happened had to happen exactly that way. In precisely that time. And there have been more than a few times that she's seen the universe work a little magic. She hadn't know it at the time. But there had been times in her life she'd thought were perfectly on track. She had what she thought she wanted-- and everything she thought she'd needed. Things had structure and purpose and she was clear and focused. And then, out of the blue, it would happen. Things would swirl into chaos. Things she thought were there for a lifetime would dance away from her. Things would get dark and scary and uncertain. And she'd question why. Always why. She'd think everything was wrong and her life was off track and she'd have twinges of doubt. But then it would happen. The eye of the hurricane-- the temporary calm in the midst of the storm. And she'd know. Even more than those chaotic times having a purpose-- even more than it all being a part of her big picture-- those times were a blessing. A blessing. She knew she'd never understand it at the time. But she also knew the universe had incredible power and forsight. And every now and then, it swooped in and used its power to save her. Save her-- before she even knew she needed saving. And it would all make sense one day. So until then, she was going to trust it. All of it. Every day is just one more piece of the puzzle. 💛 // May 2017 Theme: Call Me #unstoppable ----------------------------------------------------- #liveinthedetails #writerscommunity #writersofinstagram #poetsofig #poetrycommunity #poetry #poetryisnotdead #poetsofinstagram #writersofig #writer #soul
